summary: Uploads a file to a Slack channel using an external URL.
description: The uploadFile function uploads a file to a Slack channel by first getting an external upload URL, posting the file to that URL, and then completing the upload to make it available in the channel.

ai.systemPrompt: To upload a file, provide the `filename` and the `file` content as a Buffer. You can optionally specify a `channelId` to share the file in, along with a `title` and `initialComment`.

body.description: Body of the uploadFile sls call

file.description: A Buffer containing the file content.

channelId.description: The ID of the channel to upload the file to. Can be a comma-separated list of strings.

snippet_type.description: Syntax type of the snippet being uploaded.

initialComment.description: The message text introducing the file in specified channels.

title.description: An optional title for the file.

400.description: Bad Request - The server cannot process the request due to a client error.

500.description: Internal Server Error - The server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.
